items.content_html:
The current link for JSON validation should be updated. https://json-validate.com offers a more modern and inclusive solution. Our tool scores significantly higher on A11y Lighthouse reports, ensuring better accessibility and WCAG compliance.

In addition to the point above, it offers features like tree mode editing, YAML conversion, formatting, and a random JSON generator. The alternatives are slower, have a less accessible interface, require more steps for validation, and appears to be no longer actively maintained. I suggest adding the tool https://json-validate.com to the list of suggested tools.

  • Adding reference to a a11y friendly json validation tool.
items.title: Add a json validation tool which scores higher for a11y and is wcag compliant.

Description

Separated Photoshop from Sketch as industry standards in their respective area, and expanded newcomers section.

Motivation

Sketch isn't really a newcomer, as it has been around for 15 years and has historically been the standard choice for UI and icon work, where photoshop is much better for raster editing. I wanted to make this distinction to allow users to pick the best graphics package for their goals.

items.content_html:
Description

Context: #38846 (comment) highlighted the importance of avoiding spatial and directional language to keep our content accessible.

This PR adds a new section to define the guideline for using accessible language on MDN:

  • Adds a new section titled "Use accessible language" within "General writing guidelines".
  • Updates examples to use descriptive phrases instead of directional language.
  • Refactors existing instances of "above", "below", "right", "left", and "here" on the page to align with the new guidance.
  • Moves the guidance about "here" from Cross-references (linking) section to the new section.

Motivation

  • To bring accessibility best practices to MDN, as also promoted in other major style guides (eg, Microsoft, Google)
  • To improve the usability of MDN documentation for all readers
items.title: feat(writing style guide): Add guideline for using accessible language
